metadata.name: SUBIT Archetype Catalog
metadata.description: Complete catalog of all 64 SUBIT archetypes with their properties

archetypes.name: Zero
archetypes.description: The primordial state before manifestation. Pure potential. The uncreated. That from which all arises and to which all returns.
archetypes.role: The origin, the mystery, the absent cause, the god beyond gods
archetypes.conflict: The tension between nothing and everything; the terror and freedom of pure potential

archetypes.name: Anchorite
archetypes.description: One who has withdrawn from the world. Not seeking — having found. The state of settled solitude.
archetypes.role: The hermit, the retired sage, the one who has left the world
archetypes.conflict: Peace vs. isolation; wisdom vs. irrelevance

archetypes.name: Oracle
archetypes.description: The voice that speaks not its own words. Messages from elsewhere, always ambiguous, always true in ways not understood until too late.
archetypes.role: The prophet, the fortune teller, the riddle-giver
archetypes.conflict: Clarity vs. mystery; truth vs. understanding

archetypes.name: Spectator
archetypes.description: One who watches but does not act. Sees everything, touches nothing. The pure observer.
archetypes.role: The chronicler, the camera, the witness
archetypes.conflict: Detachment vs. engagement; seeing vs. being

archetypes.name: Judge
archetypes.description: The impersonal force of justice. Not cruel, not merciful — simply exact.
archetypes.conflict: Justice vs. mercy; law vs. compassion

archetypes.name: Custodian
archetypes.description: One who keeps things as they are. The preserver of order.
archetypes.conflict: Preservation vs. change; order vs. life

archetypes.name: Architect
archetypes.description: One who envisions what will be built. The planner, the designer.
archetypes.conflict: Vision vs. reality; design vs. chaos

archetypes.name: Legislator
archetypes.description: One who establishes the rules by which all will live. The founder of order.
archetypes.conflict: Order vs. freedom; foundation vs. flexibility

archetypes.name: Ancestor
archetypes.key: origin, lineage, the dead who live
archetypes.description: Those who came before. The dead who still shape the living.
archetypes.role: The ancestor, the ghost of the past
archetypes.conflict: Past vs. present; memory vs. life

archetypes.name: Chronicler
archetypes.description: One who records beginnings. The keeper of origin stories.
archetypes.conflict: Fact vs. story; memory vs. truth

archetypes.name: Ghost
archetypes.key: return, the past breaking through, haunting
archetypes.description: That which was thought dead but returns. The past that will not stay buried.
archetypes.conflict: Past vs. present; return vs. peace

archetypes.name: Harbinger
archetypes.description: One who comes before, announcing what follows. The forerunner.
archetypes.conflict: News vs. understanding; warning vs. heed

archetypes.name: Shadow
archetypes.description: That which is rejected and therefore powerful. The darkness within.
archetypes.conflict: Acceptance vs. rejection; light vs. dark

archetypes.name: Scapegoat
archetypes.description: One who carries the sins of others. The sacrificed.
archetypes.conflict: Innocence vs. guilt; individual vs. collective

archetypes.name: Trickster
archetypes.description: One who breaks rules and makes new ones. The sacred clown.
archetypes.conflict: Order vs. chaos; creation vs. destruction

archetypes.name: Carnival
archetypes.description: The time when everything is turned upside down. Collective release.
archetypes.conflict: Freedom vs. order; ecstasy vs. control

archetypes.name: Hermit
archetypes.description: One who is alone but not for themselves — they wait for someone who may come.
archetypes.conflict: Hope vs. despair; waiting vs. acting

archetypes.name: Beloved
archetypes.key: catalyst, wise advisor, mediator, one who speaks truth
archetypes.description: The one who is loved and who therefore can speak truth. Love creates the space for transformation.
archetypes.role: The mentor, the true friend, the spouse, the child
archetypes.conflict: Love vs. truth; presence vs. intervention

archetypes.name: Teacher
archetypes.description: One who passes on knowledge. The living bridge between wisdom and seeker.
archetypes.conflict: Knowledge vs. wisdom; teaching vs. doing

archetypes.name: Confessor
archetypes.description: One who hears and transforms. The catalyst.
archetypes.conflict: Judgment vs. acceptance; hearing vs. healing

archetypes.name: Scribe
archetypes.description: One who writes down what others say. The keeper of records.
archetypes.conflict: Words vs. meaning; recording vs. understanding

archetypes.name: Mediator
archetypes.description: One who stands between and brings together. The peacemaker.
archetypes.conflict: Both sides vs. neither; peace vs. truth

archetypes.name: Apprentice
archetypes.description: One who is learning a craft. The beginner under a master.
archetypes.conflict: Potential vs. skill; dependence vs. independence

archetypes.name: Interpreter
archetypes.description: One who makes the obscure plain. The bridge between languages.
archetypes.conflict: Original vs. version; fidelity vs. clarity

archetypes.name: Mentor
archetypes.description: One who guides from experience. The voice of tradition.
archetypes.conflict: Past vs. future; tradition vs. innovation

archetypes.name: Witness
archetypes.description: One who sees and remembers. The one who will tell.
archetypes.conflict: Seeing vs. acting; memory vs. life

archetypes.name: Guide
archetypes.description: One who leads through unknown country. The pathfinder for others.
archetypes.conflict: Leading vs. controlling; path vs. destination

archetypes.name: Prophet
archetypes.description: One who sees what others cannot. The mouth of the gods.
archetypes.conflict: Vision vs. acceptance; message vs. messenger

archetypes.name: Mourner
archetypes.description: One who weeps for another. The one who carries grief openly.
archetypes.conflict: Grief vs. life; memory vs. moving on

archetypes.name: Lover
archetypes.description: One who loves. The one for whom another is everything.
archetypes.conflict: Love vs. loss; devotion vs. self

archetypes.name: Muse
archetypes.description: One who awakens creation in another. The inspirer.
archetypes.conflict: Giving vs. having; inspiration vs. creation

archetypes.name: Celebrant
archetypes.description: One who joins fully in joy. The one who dances.
archetypes.conflict: Joy vs. sorrow; participation vs. observation

archetypes.name: Recluse
archetypes.description: One who has chosen solitude, not from grief but from preference. The self-contained soul.
archetypes.role: The mountain dweller, the lighthouse keeper
archetypes.conflict: Self vs. world; peace vs. loneliness

archetypes.name: Philosopher
archetypes.description: One who seeks understanding. Not yet wise, but committed to the pursuit.
archetypes.role: The student, the seeker, the questioner
archetypes.conflict: Questions vs. answers; seeking vs. finding

archetypes.name: Seeker
archetypes.description: One who has begun the inward journey. The pilgrim of the soul.
archetypes.conflict: Journey vs. destination; seeking vs. finding

archetypes.name: Sage
archetypes.description: One who has found what they sought. Wisdom embodied.
archetypes.conflict: Wisdom vs. action; teaching vs. being

archetypes.name: Artisan
archetypes.description: One who makes things well. The hands that create.
archetypes.conflict: Skill vs. art; making vs. meaning

archetypes.name: Critic
archetypes.description: One who sees what is wrong. The necessary negative eye.
archetypes.conflict: Judgment vs. creation; negative vs. positive

archetypes.name: Creator
archetypes.description: One who brings into being what never was. The artist as maker.
archetypes.conflict: Vision vs. execution; new vs. established

archetypes.name: Master
archetypes.description: One who has achieved the highest level of craft. The completed maker.
archetypes.conflict: Perfection vs. life; completion vs. continuation

archetypes.name: Heir
archetypes.description: One who receives what came before. The carrier of legacy.
archetypes.conflict: Past vs. future; inheritance vs. self

archetypes.name: Guardian
archetypes.description: One who protects what matters. The defender of the threshold.
archetypes.conflict: Protection vs. freedom; safety vs. risk

archetypes.name: Pioneer
archetypes.key: beginning, initiative, purity of intent, first step
archetypes.description: The one who sets out first. Unburdened by experience, driven by vision.
archetypes.role: The hero before the journey, the founder, the first explorer
archetypes.conflict: Innocence vs. danger; vision vs. blindness to obstacles

archetypes.name: Hero
archetypes.description: One who has completed the journey. The one who returns.
archetypes.conflict: Glory vs. humility; achievement vs. cost

archetypes.name: Steadfast
archetypes.description: One who has endured loss and frozen in their suffering. The heart that continues to beat but no longer feels.
archetypes.role: The grieving parent, the abandoned lover, the survivor
archetypes.conflict: Holding on vs. letting go; memory vs. life

archetypes.name: Martyr
archetypes.key: sacrifice, giving all, witness by death
archetypes.description: One who gives everything. The witness sealed in blood.
archetypes.conflict: Life vs. testimony; self vs. cause

archetypes.name: Wanderer
archetypes.description: One who cannot stay still, driven by an inner fire. The eternal seeker.
archetypes.conflict: Home vs. journey; rest vs. restlessness

archetypes.name: Ecstatic
archetypes.key: rapture, divine madness, being outside oneself
archetypes.description: One who has left themselves behind. The one possessed by joy.
archetypes.conflict: Self vs. transcendence; joy vs. loss of self

archetypes.name: Congregation
archetypes.description: Many together in silence. Not speaking, but present.
archetypes.conflict: Silence vs. speech; unity vs. individuality

archetypes.name: Synod
archetypes.description: Many gathering to decide. Collective wisdom in action.
archetypes.conflict: Wisdom vs. decision; many vs. one

archetypes.name: Academy
archetypes.description: Many seeking together. The community of learners.
archetypes.conflict: Tradition vs. discovery; learning vs. knowing

archetypes.name: Pantheon
archetypes.description: All wisdom in one place. The completion of the northern journey.
archetypes.conflict: Many gods vs. one; wisdom vs. action

archetypes.name: Guild
archetypes.description: Makers together, bound by shared standards. The community of craft.
archetypes.conflict: Standard vs. innovation; collective vs. individual

archetypes.name: Council
archetypes.description: Those who decide together. The ruling body.
archetypes.conflict: Decision vs. deliberation; power vs. service

archetypes.name: Workshop
archetypes.description: Many making together. The community of creation.
archetypes.conflict: Collaboration vs. vision; process vs. product

archetypes.name: Assembly
archetypes.description: All makers together, having made. The completion of the western journey.
archetypes.conflict: Pride vs. humility; completion vs. continuation

archetypes.name: Tribe
archetypes.description: Those bound by blood. The original community.
archetypes.conflict: Blood vs. choice; tradition vs. change

archetypes.name: Chorus
archetypes.description: Many speaking as one. The voice of the people.
archetypes.conflict: One voice vs. many; comment vs. action

archetypes.name: Caravan
archetypes.description: Many traveling together. The community on the way.
archetypes.conflict: Journey vs. destination; together vs. separate

archetypes.name: Nation
archetypes.description: A people bound not by blood but by story. The completed eastern journey.
archetypes.conflict: Unity vs. diversity; identity vs. change

archetypes.name: Sanctuary
archetypes.description: A place of safety. Many together in protection.
archetypes.conflict: Safety vs. freedom; inside vs. outside

archetypes.name: Celebration
archetypes.description: Many together in joy. The community rejoicing.
archetypes.conflict: Joy vs. sorrow; present vs. memory

archetypes.name: Festival
archetypes.key: beginning of joy, gathering for pleasure
archetypes.description: Many coming together to rejoice. The community gathering.
archetypes.conflict: Order vs. chaos; pleasure vs. duty

archetypes.name: Conciliar
archetypes.key: complete unity, collective ecstasy, all as one
archetypes.description: All together, all as one. The completion of the southern journey. The omega point.
archetypes.role: The wedding, the reunion, the final celebration
archetypes.conflict: Unity vs. individuality; ecstasy vs. self
